types.title: Depression
types.description: Depression, also known as major depressive disorder or clinical depression, is a common and serious mood disorder that affects how you feel, think, and handle daily activities. It's characterized by persistent feelings of sadness, hopelessness, and a lack of interest or pleasure in activities the person usually enjoys.
types.details: Depression does not have a single cause. It can be triggered by a life crisis, physical illness, or something else - but it can also occur spontaneously. It's believed to be caused by a combination of genetic, biological, environmental, and psychological factors (National Institute of Mental Health, 2021).

types.title: Anxiety
types.description: Anxiety is a normal and often healthy emotion. However, when a person regularly feels disproportionate levels of anxiety, it might become a medical disorder. Anxiety disorders form a category of mental health diagnoses leading to excessive nervousness, fear, apprehension, and worry.
types.details: Anxiety is a mental health condition characterized by intense feelings of worry, fear, or apprehension. It is a normal and adaptive response to stress and can be beneficial in some situations, but when it becomes excessive and interferes with daily life, it can be considered a disorder.

types.title: FinancialCrisis
types.details: A group of conditions SLEEEEPP with the elevation or lowering of a person's mood, such as depression or bipolar disorder.
